summary: This bill, the Wildfire Insurance Coverage Study Act of 2025, mandates the Government Accountability Office (GAO) to study insurance coverage for wildfire damage. The study will analyze wildfire risk in the U.S., including trends in declarations, mitigation practices, and existing government programs. It will also examine the current state of insurance coverage, regulatory responses by states, challenges faced by insurers, and potential solutions. The GAO will submit a report to Congress within 12 months of the Act's enactment.
